text: I found a typo on CRAN policies <https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/policies.html#Source-packages> cicrumvented > circumvented. Where should I send a patch?

elements.text: I found a typo on CRAN policies
cicrumvented > circumvented. Where should I send a patch?

text:
This is a good question (cc <@U01LM3R61HV>)! On <https://cran.r-project.org/> it says in the footer

> For queries about this web site, please contact <mailto:cran-sysadmin@r-project.org|the webmaster>.
So I would do that. The source of the CRAN Policy is in the CRAN/Policy directory of <https://svn.r-project.org/R-dev-web/trunk/>, so you should be able to create a patch from that. (The R-dev-web SVN repo is mostly sources for <https://developer.r-project.org/> rather than <https://cran.r-project.org/>, so I'm not you'd be able to create a patch if the typo was somewhere else on the CRAN website).

text: I was wondering if it needs to be submitted to Bugzilla, as we were discussing in the last weekly meet?

text: so CRAN is technically distinct from R-core as an entity, though there is overlap in membership. I don’t know where you’d submit a CRAN bug, honestly

text: :man-shrugging:
Good question by <@U01ECGRL8CB> on where to submit a CRAN bug in general. If there is a common place for CRAN bugs submission then maybe we can point to it in the guide.

elements.text: Good question by
on where to submit a CRAN bug in general. If there is a common place for CRAN bugs submission then maybe we can point to it in the guide.

text: The CRAN policy has a GitHub repo. I‘d file an issue there. <https://github.com/eddelbuettel/crp/tree/master/txt|https://github.com/eddelbuettel/crp/tree/master/txt>

elements.text: The CRAN policy has a GitHub repo. I‘d file an issue there.
https://github.com/eddelbuettel/crp/tree/master/txt

text: you can reach out to those people, explain to them the goals of what you’re doing re the dev guide, and ask them what they would like you to put as instructions for reporting cran policy bugs

text: <@U01ECGRL8CB> I am looking at your ALTREP `duplicated()` patch for inclusion in this release. Would you be able to add a patch to one of the files in `/tests` to cover some basic cases?

elements.text: I am looking at your ALTREP
duplicated()
patch for inclusion in this release. Would you be able to add a patch to one of the files in
/tests
to cover some basic cases?

text: Yes, the GitHub repo is just a mirror of the SVN repo as described in this nice post: <https://blog.r-hub.io/2019/05/29/keep-up-with-cran/> - it's where I found the link to the original SVN!

attachments.title: How to keep up with CRAN policies and processes? - R-hub blog
attachments.text: CRAN, the Comprehensive R Archive Network, changes its rules and workflow every so often: see for instance the new encoding setting of one of its check flavors. As a package developer, you’d better keep up with CRAN policies and processes to be able to safely retain your package(s) on CRAN and to prepare your next submissions with as much information as possible. We at R-hub are also every interested in not missing updates, in particular of the check setups, in order for our services to serve package developers as well as possible.
attachments.fallback: How to keep up with CRAN policies and processes? - R-hub blog

elements.text: Yes, the GitHub repo is just a mirror of the SVN repo as described in this nice post:
- it's where I found the link to the original SVN!

text:
<@U01JACR6L7L> thats great news, thanks for looking at that.

Yes, I can adapt some of the tests from the test script I submitted into a patch in /tests. It won’t catch any bugs (cause the script all passes for me or I wouldn’t have submitted) but it will put the guarantees into the tests. If you have any cases that weren’t covered by the script that you want added as well let me know and I’ll be happy to do that as well.

elements.text:
thats great news, thanks for looking at that.

Yes, I can adapt some of the tests from the test script I submitted into a patch in /tests. It won’t catch any bugs (cause the script all passes for me or I wouldn’t have submitted) but it will put the guarantees into the tests. If you have any cases that weren’t covered by the script that you want added as well let me know and I’ll be happy to do that as well.

text: Thanks. It does look like you’ve done substantial testing. There are probably other tests of `duplicated()` in `/tests` somewhere, so you could merge your tests with those.

duplicated()
in

somewhere, so you could merge your tests with those.
